result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Mental Health Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any victim or the Target Stores.
No violent contact with any family member.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael L Bell in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

45 DAYS  Jail consecutive 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

 CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No contact with:  
any victim or the Target stores
*No violent contact with any family member
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done. 
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE $100.00 (TO BE PAID AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION)
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael L Bell in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing at 03-16-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Michael L Bell in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel was just appointed and is waiting for Discovery and request adjournment. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 02-08-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any family member.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Michael L Bell in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Attorney Mark P. Powers in court.   Defendant Michael L Bell did not appear.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Powers moves to withdraw as counsel. Court grants. Warrant/Capias remains outstanding.
Initial appearance at 12-17-2015 09:00 am

Attorney Mark P. Powers in court as friend of the court.  Defendant Michael L Bell did not appear.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Michael L Bell not in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the letter filed.    Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
